Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup with turn of foot; exterior glazed black; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of man courting youth, (eye, nose, added red beard and chest partly in added red of man, to right, with left hand raised, touching youth under chin; upper part of long-haired youth to left (top of head missing, incised side-lock, red on ponytail at nape of neck, red chest) with right hand raised to man’s beard; behind youth in field on right part of possible red garment.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.28)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 260-1, no. 26)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 378, no. B725)
Brijder 1991 / Siana Cups II, The Heidelberg Painter (no. 474, pl. 150d)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0381) (Phase 1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 4)
Exhibition history: 2019 8 Jun-31 Aug Norfolk & Norwich Millennium Library, Desire, love, identity: exploring LGBTQ histories 2019 15 Mar-26 May, Bolton Museum, Desire, love, identity: exploring LGBTQ histories 2018-2019 14 Dec-3 Mar, National Justice Museum, Desire, love, identity: exploring LGBTQ histories 2018 25 Sep– 2 Dec, Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, Desire, love, identity: exploring LGBTQ histories 2019 21 Sep-17 Nov Shire Hall Historic Courthouse Museum, Dorchester, Desire, love, identity: exploring LGBTQ histories
